conclusion: Light starts from point O and travels towards boundary AB; refractive index of medium is sqrt(2); angle of incidence at point O is 45 degrees.
Using Snell's Law, calculate angle of refraction theta_2 as 30 degrees.
Light travels along path OC inside the medium; path OC is hypotenuse of right triangle with angle 30 degrees.
Calculate speed of light in medium as c/sqrt(2) and time t as d*sqrt(2)/c.
Final answer: time t for light to travel from point O to boundary AB is d*sqrt(2)/c.
